action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I am starting with a common five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants.
guess: house

attempts = 1
target_word = squat
guess = house
guess_feedback = h<red> o<red> u<green> s<yellow> e<red>

guess_feedback: h<red> o<red> u<green> s<yellow> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "u" is green, it means "u" is in the correct position. "s" is yellow, indicating it is in the word but not in the correct position. I will try to build on this information by keeping "u" and "s" in the word and changing the other letters.
guess: trust

attempts = 2
target_word = squat
guess = trust
guess_feedback = t<red> r<red> u<green> s<yellow> t<green>

guess_feedback: t<red> r<red> u<green> s<yellow> t<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "u" and "s" are still in the word, with "u" in the correct position. I will try to keep "u" and "s" and add a new letter "t" is green in the second position but not in first, I will try to utilize this.
guess: trust

attempts = 3
target_word = squat
guess = trust
guess_feedback = t<red> r<red> u<green> s<yellow> t<green>

guess_feedback: t<red> r<red> u<green> s<yellow> t<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "t" cannot be in the first position, I will try to put it in the last position and keep "u" in the same position, and try a new combination with "s" 
guess: burst

attempts = 4
target_word = squat
guess = burst
guess_feedback = b<red> u<yellow> r<red> s<yellow> t<green>

guess_feedback: b<red> u<yellow> r<red> s<yellow> t<green>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "t" is still in the correct position at the end, and "s" is still in the word but not in the correct position. I will try to keep "t" at the end and "s" in the word, and change the other letters. I also noticed that "u" was in the correct position earlier, so I will try to put it back.
guess: gusto

attempts = 5
target_word = squat
guess = gusto
guess_feedback = g<red> u<yellow> s<yellow> t<yellow> o<red>

guess_feedback: g<red> u<yellow> s<yellow> t<yellow> o<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: Since "u", "s", and "t" are all yellow, indicating they are in the word but not in the correct position, I will try to rearrange them and keep "u", "s", and "t" in the word.
guess: stout

attempts = 6
target_word = squat
guess = stout
guess_feedback = s<green> t<red> o<red> u<yellow> t<green>

guess_explanation: I am starting with a common five-letter English word that has a good balance of vowels and consonants.

Since "u" is green, it means "u" is in the correct position. "s" is yellow, indicating it is in the word but not in the correct position. I will try to build on this information by keeping "u" and "s" in the word and changing the other letters.

The feedback indicates that "u" and "s" are still in the word, with "u" in the correct position. I will try to keep "u" and "s" and add a new letter "t" is green in the second position but not in first, I will try to utilize this.
Since "t" cannot be in the first position, I will try to put it in the last position and keep "u" in the same position, and try a new combination with "s"

The feedback indicates that "t" is still in the correct position at the end, and "s" is still in the word but not in the correct position. I will try to keep "t" at the end and "s" in the word, and change the other letters. I also noticed that "u" was in the correct position earlier, so I will try to put it back.
Since "u", "s", and "t" are all yellow, indicating they are in the word but not in the correct position, I will try to rearrange them and keep "u", "s", and "t" in the word.
